document_title: Gallbladder sludge: Causes, symptoms and prevention
subsection_name: soi-bun-tui-mat.json_9_Will gallbladder sludge go away on its own?
subsection_content:
Mudstones in the gallbladder can completely heal on their own and never return. They can also disappear and then recur or lead to the formation of gallstones. This condition often causes pain that lasts for several hours. If you notice sudden and severe abdominal pain, the patient should immediately contact a doctor for early examination. Most people with gallbladder sludge stones can live normal and healthy lives, even without treatment. However, many cases still relapse again after treatment.
